author: vilela
title: Cardano Training & Complex Networks
description: 巴西是拉丁美洲的一个国家，而我们的学生、专业人士和企业家仍然不知道Cardano区块链网络。

f6_assessments.q0: 这个建议与挑战赛的目标完全一致，因为这个想法是创建一个课程，可以向巴西的专业人士传授Cardano区块链网络。这样一来，它肯定会给生态系统带来很多好处，因为它将带来几个有能力的新成员（我们知道巴西是南美最大的强国，那里有很多事情要做，但缺少的正是这个，适当的指导）。还有，很明显，国家，因为它可以为几个专业人员产生大量的工作机会，他们遭受了国家的金融危机，这主要是在大流行病之后加剧的--几个合格的专业人员已经被雇用，在寻找机会方面有很大的困难。作者很积极地确定了项目的目标受众是谁，这显示了非常重要的现实感，他知道自己要做什么，要为谁做，这产生了一个重要的指导方针，我将在接下来的几个主题中更好地评论这个指导方针。它还概述了课程中会涉及的一些主题，以便我们对这里的工作内容有一个确切的预览。它还确定了课程的总时长，为我们产生了一个良好的时间感。而最有意义的是，这个课程将是免费的，也就是说，我们都可以参加，这打破了社会障碍，充分有利于拉丁美洲的位置。总的来说，我不认为我对这个提议的影响有什么可批评的，它是完全满足我们在这个挑战中所寻找的东西。
f6_assessments.q1: 说到团队，我相信整个项目将由一个人进行。我非常喜欢这个想法，但我认为如果我们在这里有一个小组会更好。将要讲课的作者无疑是非常有能力的，他是物理学博士，是巴西联邦大学的教授，等等。但是，如果能更好地了解他和区块链Cardano之间的直接关系，那就很有意思了。他是如何发现这个项目的？加入这个社区有多久了？究竟，他在这里发展什么？我希望这样的疑惑能得到解决。我认为在这里聘请两位专业人士是很重要的：一位是设计师，负责准备课程的视觉内容和平面宣传品；另一位是来自市场部的人，负责制定沟通策略，使课程有广泛的公众参与。就剧本而言，这部分是完美的。作者根据每个月的活动进行划分，从1到6，每个月都有很好的主题解释。会发生什么，谁什么顺序，使我们对这个过程有充分的了解，不留空白。每月的解释还伴随着每个月的解雇费用，这也使得预算收益率非常合理。所以我认为唯一可以改进的部分是澄清作者与Cardano生态系统的联系。
f6_assessments.q2: 我相信这是一个容易审计的提案，我将告诉你原因。作者为我们提供了一个非常好的脚本，非常准确，充满了细节。通过这个，我们可以准确地监测，每个月，承诺的事情是否在做。我建议应该由巴西本土的Cardano社区成员来做；这样的话，社区和作者之间可以有一个直接的对话，并逐步跟进，以监测过程而不仅仅是结果。但是，谈到他们，必须强调这个课程对当地居民的影响。在我看来，这一部分应该由作者本人来完成。一种课程后的数据调查，他将与一些学生直接接触，以获得关于课程质量和对他们实际生活影响的反馈。这些教诲是否打开了大门？如果是的话，是哪些？那些参与的人是否打算成为Cardano社区的积极成员，要么通过Catalyst，要么作为区块链开发者在各种提案中工作？这种类型的数据可以被收集并传递给社区。有了这两项分析，我相信完全可以以一种非常恰当和安全的方式来审计该提案。

f6_assessments.q0:
Although there are other proposals with similar obvjective, It's good to have more options of Blockchain/Cardano courses in Brazil as this subject is not so commonly taught in the whole latin american, so its a valide proposal addressing the challenge. I also liked it will be offered both online and face to face and that the course will be free. these things combined help to expand the reach of it across local coomunity and the whole country.
In general, the proposal is well strucutured and well written.

It would be nice to see it mentioned here the number of students it is intended to have (both online and face to face), to assess better the impact and quality, and its recurrence (whether it will be offered once, or more times a year).

As further suggestions, I'd try to detail more the communicaction plan/strategy to engage students in Brazil as a whole (I liked though that the target audience is already mentioned). I'd add here some focus on trying to attarct low income students as much as possible; It will be in line with UN SDG 1, 4, 8 and 10 and increase proposals appeal.
f6_assessments.q1:
One already commited person with educational experience and knowledge in blockchain seems to be enough to run this project, with no need to extra hirigings. Its rpossible to verify these credential with links and information provided.

The plan is solid and time-framed with a planning, implementation, operation and finalization part. the budget is fairly distribuited across project phases, I'd just try to roughly say in which itens of the phase the money is being spent on (materials, paid hours, infrastrucutre, research, communication and so on).
In general, the project seems really feasible.
f6_assessments.q2:
Milestones can be extracted from the plan but the most important ones should be better highlighted. What was called "milestone" in the proposal is actually more of a description/goal of the project phase than proper a milestone (an important/key point in schedule with zero duration) itself.

Theres no numeric metrics proposed - What is called KPIs/indicators here in the proposal are actually activities in the project.
As suggestions of true metrics, it would be nice to measure the number of people reached in communication, the number of students engaged/registered and the quality of the course (it could be measured by a NPS, for example, at the end of it or a survey with students). They should have some targets to fully assess how successful the project was.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great idea that would help the Cardano ecosystem to expand and would certainly add value in that way. Especially when it comes to students, professionals, and entrepreneurs. The proposal clearly shows how the Cardano ecosystem can expand its community and what the impact would be. The current problem in Brazil is pointed out, and that is the no knowledge of the Cardano  Blockchain Network, but it also offers an excellent solution to this problem. KPIs in the proposal match the ones indicated in the challenge and yes proposal is able to scale future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: In the proposal we find a link to the website with all the necessary information about the person behind this project. We can conclude that the course will be led by the person behind this whole project but the question is whether it will be feasible individually or a team is needed? In the detailed CV we can't find the necessary experience, skills and knowledge that the lecturer should have. The budget is clearly presented but it would be much better if it was divided differently. Maybe to require half the budget in this Catalys F7 and half in the Catalsy F8. Holding a lecture for 6 months is a challenging job and is not a safe investment. But if they had a 3-month lecture, it would be easier to follow the development of the project and influence the improvements. There is a detailed implementable plan and it is very well developed as well as details of actionable tasks and order of execution are presented. The proposal offered a timetable to complete the work but in my opinion it is not realistically presented. As I already said there could be a much better brake down budget but also a time frame from 6 months to 3 months of lectures. We can find in the proposal a clear explanation of technical aspects and technologies for implementation but there is a lack of insight into possible risks and they could be especially in online workshops. What if the students don't come? It would be good to address the possible risks.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal does not have a clearly defined roadmap in terms of date or for exmaple (Q1, Q2, Q3) when the course will take place. It has already been presented in 1 month and up to 6 months. KPIs are well presented and developed and it is very easy for the community to follow the development and success of this project. Especially if every course is going to be recorded.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal stands out for its ambition, professionalism and clarity. Boosting the Cardano ecosystem would be achieved by associating the blockchain with high-quality scientific content in a country that values academic achievement and looks up to its teachers and researchers. By moving cryptocurrencies in general and Cardano in particular out of the realm of a tool for speculation and into the curriculum for higher learning, the continent's view of Cardano will indeed grow. The bilingual presentation effectively demonstrates the proposers ability to combine regional focus with the ethos of Cardano and Project Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer seems to be uniquely placed and qualified to fulfil the challenge brief and proposal roadmap. The timeline and milestones appear to be realistic and modestly priced, and the milestone goals build upon each other in a coherent, logical and convincing manner. Although the proposer does not seem to have direct experience with content creation and social media campaigning, this should be possible given the ability to structure and delegate demonstrated in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Presenting the roadmap in the format of six monthly milestones will help to audit the proposal. Performance metrics could be geared more towards successful community reach, mentions, social media likes or other such measures of interaction. The thoughtful presentation and suitable profile of the proposer mitigate some of my concerns in this regard, but more focus should have been given to distribution of quality content as opposed to simply creating.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is about developing a solid blockchain-complex networks framework for Brazilian audience (university students, professionals, enthusiasts, and entrepreneurs) in Brazilian Portuguese, and introducing them to the Cardano blockchain technology (for free). It is clearly within the challenge and valuable to the growth of Cardano ecosystem. It is also able to scale to address future challenge (to widen out of the region, multilingual, to help users around the world – for example).
Due to strong points above, I strongly agree this proposal is impactful.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal provides a link which is fulfilling details about the proposer to prove he has skills and experience to implement the proposal.
The budget is devided fairly ($2337 each month in plan 6 months) but not clearly broken down into identifiable items. I understand from month 1 to month 5 KPIs are materials and lessons, so it might be difficult to split costs. However, identifiable items in month 6 should be explained more details and have their costs so that readers are more easy to assess the proposal's feasibility. 
Besides, I would like to be more understandable about this statement in the proposal: 'budget already includes an Overhead of USD 2,000 used to cover indirect costs and improve the computational infrastructure used for scientific research in our institution Universidade de Pernambuco' because due to my calculation $2337 x5+$2340 = $14025 total the budget and I cannot find where is $2000 mentioned above. I recommend the proposal should be more details in the finance section.
 I also recommend the proposer should consider challenges and risks relevant to the successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has a roadmap with milestones and time horizon for achievement.
Metrics/KPIs is included clearly to be audited. However, it will be difficult to audit in month 6: I m not sure these items in month 6 milestone are KPIs or not – the proposer did not mention KPIs as he did from month 1 to 5. ('1.Grow Cardano, Grow Latin America', '2. End of course with a Cardano Blockchain Network Online Event', '3. Preparation of the final report') If they are KPIs, they are so difficult to be audit the success. If they are not, so where are the Metrics/KPIs in month 6 to be audited?  Therefore, I recommend the proposal should add more details to be audited month 6 easier.

f6_assessments.q0: Providing course to promote Cardano and its consensus protocol is a great way to raise awareness about Cardano ecosystem and therefore we can attract more member to our community. It is a traditional method but still very effective to PR for anything. With currently pandamic situation, online course is suitable.
f6_assessments.q1: He has many experience in researching. The course is planed well with detail timeline. I minus one star for the risk that he couldn't attract many students to his course or his ability in speaking/teaching is not good. However I assume these risk is small.
f6_assessments.q2: The Roadmap and KPIs are very details and easy to track. He splits the plan into phases and lists the action/target topic will be conducted on each phase.

f6_assessments.q0: This idea is absolutely great! Brazil consists of the 1/3 of the whole Latin America population and still is not informed about the blockchain technology and how much more about the Cardano network. A completely free online course about all the concepts regarding Cardano would be a step to bring a lot more people into the ecosystem. It would surely have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem, as the KPIs match the ones indicated in the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has a remarkable number of publications and so does have the experience to make this idea successful. He also provides the links to verify that and all of his experience and publications. The proposer by themselves will make the idea come through so there aren't any team mates taking part in this. The funding will be for the course to be a success. There is a fully detailed implementable plan for this project and the timetable seems quite realistic.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon and cites every single stage of the course with the budget that will be needed for each stage. There aren't any metrics to measure the success of the proposal. What could be a metric, is how many participants the course will have and how many of them will complete the course successfully. That is probably how the progress of the proposal can be tracked. Would the proposer also provide the success metrics, this proposal would be absolutely exciting!

solution: 通过关于复杂网络理论和区块链技术的综合在线课程，推广Cardano及其共识协议。
experience: 我是一名物理学博士，Cardano爱好者，大学教授，复杂网络科学和共识形成机制的研究者。
